titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Lungren, Daniel E. asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: War crimes, genocide, crimes against humanity

bill.summary: 4/14/2011--Passed Senate without amendment. Authorizes the use of the Capitol rotunda on May 17, 2011, for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.
